SENT.plain: A 27-year-old woman in the ninth month of her pregnancy suddently developed nausea and motor weakness of her right lower extremity while shopping
Subsequently a disturbance of consciousness and right-sided hemiparesis developed
Spinal puncture yielded clear CSF but CT scan demonstrated a left subependymal hematoma
Angiographical examination led to a diagnosis of "Moyamoya" disease
The source of the intracranial hemorrhage could not be identified
The hematoma could not have been diagnosed accurately without the CT scan
